weapon.name: Accurate
weapon.description: +10 to any Test when firing this weapon.

weapon.name: Blackpowder
weapon.description: Targets must pass an Average (+20) Cool Test or take a Broken Condition, even if the shot misses.

weapon.name: Blast (Rating)
weapon.description: All within (Rating) yards, suffers the Damage and Conditions the weapon inflicts.

weapon.name: Damaging
weapon.description: Use the higher score from either the units die or the SL to determine the Damage.

weapon.name: Defensive
weapon.description: Gain a bonus of +1 SL to any Melee Test when you oppose an incoming attack.

weapon.name: Distract
weapon.description: Instead of causing Damage, a successful attack with a Distracting weapon can force an opponent back 1 yard per SL by which you win the Opposed Test.

weapon.name: Entangle
weapon.description: Successful hits inflict the Entangled Condition with a Strength value equal to your Strength Characteristic. When Entangling an opponent, you cannot otherwise use the weapon to hit. You can end the Entangling when you wish.

weapon.name: Fast
weapon.description: Choose when in the Initiative sequence to strike. Opponents suffer a penalty of –10 when defending using a Melee Test, given their weapon is slower. Two opponents with Fast weapons fight in Initiative order, relative to each other.

weapon.name: Hack
weapon.description: If you hit an opponent, you Damage a struck piece of armour or shield by 1 point as well as wounding the target.

weapon.name: Impact
weapon.description: On a successful hit, cause additional damage equal to the result of the units die.

weapon.name: Impale
weapon.description: On successful combat tests, Impaling weapons also cause a Critical Hit on any number divisible by 10 (i.e.: 10, 20, 30). For ranged weapons, the ammo is lodged in the target’s body. Arrows and bolts require a Challenging (+0) Heal Test to remove. Bullets require the Surgery Talent to remove. Each unremoved projectile prevents healing of 1 Wound each.

weapon.name: Penetrating
weapon.description: Effective at penetrating armour. Non-metal APs are ignored, and the first point of all other armour is ignored

weapon.name: Pistol
weapon.description: You can use this weapon to attack in Close Combat.

weapon.name: Precise
weapon.description: When attacking, Gain +1 SL to any successful Test.

weapon.name: Pummel
weapon.description: If you score a Head hit, attempt an Opposed Strength/ Endurance Test against the struck opponent. If you win the test, your opponent gains a Stunned Condition

weapon.name: Repeater (Rating)
weapon.description: Your weapon holds (Rating) shots, automatically reloading after each time you fire. When you use all your shots, you must fully reload the weapon using the normal rules.

weapon.name: Shield (Rating)
weapon.description: You count as having (Rating) Armour Points on all locations of your body. If Shield Rating of 2 or higher, you may also Oppose incoming missile shots in your Line of Sight.

weapon.name: Trap Blade
weapon.description: Can trap weapons when scoring a Critical Hit on defence. Instead of rolling the Critical Hit, roll an Opposed Strength Test, adding your SL from the previous Melee Test. On Success, your opponent drops the blade. On Astounding Success, disarm and break the blade. On Failure, disarm fails and combat continues as normal.

weapon.name: Unbreakable
weapon.description: This weapon will not break, corrode, or lose its edge.

weapon.name: Wrap
weapon.description: Melee Tests opposing an attack from a Wrap weapon suffer a penalty of –1 SL, as parried strikes wrap over the top of shields, or around blades.

armor.name: Flexible
armor.description: Flexible armour can be worn under a layer of non-Flexible armour.You gain the benefit of both.

armor.name: Impenetrable
armor.description: All Critical Wounds caused by an odd number to hit you, such as 11 or 33, are ignored.

items.name: Durable
items.description: Item can take +Durable Damage points before it suffers any negatives and gains a saving throw of 9+ on a 1d10 roll against instant breakage. This Quality can be taken multiple times, improving the saving throw by 1 (e.g. From 9+ to 8+).

items.name: Fine
items.description: This Quality is a sign of social status and can be taken multiple times. The higher the quality, the more impressive it seems.

items.name: Practical
items.description: A failed test using this item receives +1 SL. If the item is a piece of armour, any penalties for wearing it are reduced by one level (for example from −30 to −20).

weapon.name: Dangerous
weapon.description: Any failed test including an 9 (on either 10s or units die) results in a Fumble.

weapon.name: Imprecise
weapon.description: Suffer a penalty of –1 SL when attacking with weapon.

weapon.name: Reload (Rating)
weapon.description: An unloaded weapon with this flaw requires an Extended Ranged Test for the appropriate Weapon Group scoring (Rating) SL to reload. If you are interrupted while reloading, you must start again from scratch.

weapon.name: Slow
weapon.description: Characters using Slow weapons always strike last in a Round, regardless of Initiative order. Further, opponents gain a bonus of +1 SL to any Test to defend against your attacks

weapon.name: Tiring
weapon.description: You only gain the benefit of the Impact and Damaging Weapon Traits on a Turn you Charge.

weapon.name: Undamaging
weapon.description: All APs are doubled against Undamaging weapons. Further, you do not automatically inflict a minimum of 1 Wound on a successful hit in combat.

armor.name: Partial
armor.description: The armour does not cover the entire hit location. Even rolls on hits or Critical Hits ignore the armour’s APs.

armor.name: Weakpoints
armor.description: The armour has small weakpoints. If your opponent has a weapon with the Impale Quality and scores a Critical, the APs of your armour are ignored.

items.name: Ugly
items.description: Ugly items attract negative attention, and related Fellowship Tests might even suffer a –10 penalty.

items.name: Shoddy
items.description: The item breaks when used in any failed Test rolling a double. Similarly, Shoddy armour breaks if any Critical Hit is sustained to a Hit Location it protects

items.name: Unrealiable
items.description: A failed test using this item receives –1 SL. Further, penalties for wearing Unreliable armour are doubled.

items.name: Bulky
items.description: Increase Encumbrance by +1. Bulky clothing and armour are Enc 1 even when worn, and Fatigue penalties for armour are doubled.
